name: NoRedInk
description:
NoRedInk builds stronger writers through interest-based curriculum, adaptive exercises, and actionable data. We're in over 10,000 schools, and students have answered over 2 billion questions on our platform.

Based in San Francisco, NoRedInk was founded in 2012 and is backed by top-tier investors, including: True Ventures, Google Ventures, Learn Capital, Kapor Capital, Social Capital and ImagineK12.

We are a team of ~50 people with a deep commitment to unlocking every writer’s potential. We have a strong remote culture; many of our jobs are remote-friendly. Check out our current openings at: https://www.noredink.com/jobs

# Build better writers
Engage your students. Boost their skills. Guide them through the writing process.
[Sign up for free!](http://www.noredink.com/</signup>)
Interested in [NoRedInk Premium?](http://www.noredink.com/</premium>)
![Teachers can review a student's results across all topics and can easily assign extra practice on topics the student is struggling with.](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/hero3-300x225.png) ![As students write essays, they receive scaffolded support, such as separate labeled sections for typing their "Introduction" and "Body paragraphs," and a sidebar full of guidance and examples.](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/secondary2-1-300x225.png) ![To practice topics such as "Vague and Unnecessary Language," students drag words in and out of fun sentences like “Spider-Man literally won a lifetime supply of chocolate, and his friends are jealous.”](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/hero1-300x225.png)
![Thumbnail for introduction video](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/New_Intro_Video_Thumbnail-1-300x168.png)
## A comprehensive writing platform designed for today’s classrooms
NoRedInk simplifies the process of building strong writers and critical thinkers in Grades 3–12. Our platform equips teachers to deliver high-quality writing instruction by helping them engage students through writing cycles that incorporate modeling, scaffolding, practice, and feedback.
## New in NoRedInk: Originality Insights
Originality Insights shows teachers how long students spend writing and highlights text students paste from external sources. This enables educators to make informed judgments about originality and academic integrity and leads to:
  * Increased student accountability and original thinking
  *     * Stronger, more trusting student-teacher relationships
  *     * Improved student achievement on state tests


[Learn more](http://www.noredink.com/<https:/noredink.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/30190059751323-NoRedInk-Originality-Insights>)
![](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Originality-Insights-Product-Shot-1024x920.png)
## What do educators think about NoRedInk?
![Jo Rohde photo](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/JoRohde-993395cabad20733c27fcacda6793d75.jpg)
NoRedInk has completely transformed the way I teach grammar and writing in my class. Students start each concept at their own level and learn at their own pace, and because of this type of delivery, my students not only learn grammar, they master it.
Jo Rohde, Teacher, North Dallas High School
![Kecia Waddell](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/KeciaWaddell-4d0595052f387d8cf4fa2d2235954d52.jpg)
For my students with learning disabilities, NoRedInk has reduced barriers to critical skill development in grammar and written expression. My students are appropriately challenged by NoRedInk’s student-centered, adaptive approach, and the resulting data supports my instructional planning.
Kecia Waddell, Special Education Teacher, Stevenson High School
![Travis Willard](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/TravisWillard-de1536d90227b87292d7a8ec85915249.jpg)
We feel the most powerful aspect of NoRedInk is that it meets our students at their current level of knowledge. The ability to individualize instruction, introduce new concepts, and reinforce learned skills within a single online platform is fantastic!
Travis Willard, Associate Principal, Randall High School
![Keri Bell](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/KeriBell-2b851bb73374c0e05e7234da2aa8a0e9.jpg)
NoRedInk engages students in a way that other personalized learning platforms don’t. It brings grammar instruction and practice to life by blending the rules of language with student interests and a modern interface. Our students are actually learning by doing, and teachers are able to spend more time working with individuals or small groups.
Keri Bell, Director of Literacy Programs, Harmony Public Schools
View Jo Rohde’s testimonial View Kecia Waddell’s testimonial View Travis Willard’s testimonial View Keri Bell’s testimonial
## An essential complement to core ELA curriculum
![Authentic, interactive practice](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/11084545728076921503l.svg)
Authentic, interactive practice
![Flexible writing activities icon](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/11084545728091597042l.svg)
Flexible writing activities
![Personalized, high-interest content icon](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/11084545728087403230l.svg)
Personalized, high-interest content
![Support Icon](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/11084545728089499634l.svg)
Differentiated support
![Actionable, intuitive reporting](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/11084545728085306645l.svg)
Actionable, intuitive reporting
![Icon of bar chart](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Bar-chart-icon.svg)
Standards alignment
Skill-building exercises let students restructure sentences, edit and mark up text, manipulate multi-paragraph passages, and more.
![Passages allow students to choose the correct words right within each sentence, such as by clicking a highlighted word to change it from "a" to "an."](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/feature1.png)
Lightweight writing prompts, scaffolded essays, and guided reviews give students a variety of opportunities to put their skills into action.
![A large textbox students use to respond to the following prompt: "Dogs have a way of reflecting humans' emotions. Take a look at the dogs in the pictures. Which one best expresses the way you feel today? Write a paragraph describing your current thoughts and feelings."](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/qw1.png)
Exercises incorporate each student’s favorite celebrities, characters, friends, pets, and other interests to make learning fun and engaging.
![To practice topics such as "Punctuation with Conjunctions," students drag punctuation marks in and out of fun sentences like "Dwayne Johnson doesn't like alarm clocks, so he keeps a rooster in his room."](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/feature3.png)
Adaptive exercises and scaffolded writing activities meet students where they are and deliver differentiated support when they get stuck.
![Example student writing tip that explains what makes a strong thesis, with an example of a thesis that makes an interesting point and an example of a thesis that doesn't make an interesting point.](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/feature4.png)
Diagnostic data, growth reports, and gradebooks allow teachers, admins, and other stakeholders to track student progress in real time.
![Results of a Growth Quiz show the previous class average score and the new class average score. Individual student past and new scores are shown grouped by proficiency level, with options to assign practice to students with lower new scores.](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/feature5.png)
Practice exercises, writing activities, and diagnostics can be filtered by their alignment with state and national standards and tests.
![Common Core, TEKS, SOL, NWEA MAP, SAT, ACT, Smarter Balanced, WIDA, AP English, state standards for all states](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/feature6.png)
[Explore our curriculum](http://www.noredink.com/</curriculum>)
## Take student achievement to the next level with NoRedInk Premium
Premium gives schools full access to NoRedInk’s writing curriculum and guided composition tools.
![](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Group-18-Copy.svg)
#### A wider variety of content
Exercises for 1,000+ skills, 100s of texts, prompts, and lessons, and guided practice for 10+ writing genres. 
![](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Group-5-Copy-4.svg)
#### Deeper reporting insights
Standards- and assessment-based progress reports at the teacher, school, and district level. 
![](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Group-5-Copy-3.svg)
#### Comprehensive support
Flexible professional development and seamless integrations with tools like Canvas, Clever, and Schoology. 
[Learn more about Premium](http://www.noredink.com/</product/why-premium/>)
## NoRedInk now has ELA resources for Grades 3–5
Designed specifically for young learners, our new adaptive skills exercises, engaging writing activities, and standards-aligned diagnostics enable elementary teachers to:
  * Create more moments of genuine learning
  *     * Help students develop strong writing habits
  *     * Gather data-driven insights into student growth


[Learn more](http://www.noredink.com/</product/elementary-grades-3-5>)
![](http://www.noredink.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/3–5-Homepage-Illustration-1024x638.png)

generated_description:
**NoRedInk: Cultivating Strong Writers Through Engaging Technology**

Founded in 2012 and based in San Francisco, NoRedInk is on a mission to foster strong writing skills across the education system. With backing from prominent investors like True Ventures, Google Ventures, and Y Combinator’s ImagineK12, the company has made impressive strides in the realm of educational technology. 

The platform is already making waves in over 10,000 schools, where students have tackled over 2 billion questions. At its core, NoRedInk builds its curriculum around student interests, utilizing adaptive exercises and actionable data to engage learners from Grades 3 to 12. This helps educators tailor their instruction to meet individual needs—crucial given the diverse learning styles in today's classrooms.

A standout feature is their AI-powered Grading Assistant, which streamlines the grading process for teachers, reportedly cutting grading time by 40%. This frees up valuable time for instructors to either focus on personalized instruction or engage with students more directly. 

With a compact team of about 50 members, NoRedInk embraces a robust remote culture, prioritizing flexibility and adaptability in its workforce. They aim to unlock every writer's potential, proving that learning can be both enjoyable and effective.

The platform's recent updates include Originality Insights, which helps educators monitor student writing habits, ultimately fostering creativity and academic integrity. With engaging, personalized content that reflects students' interests—be it their favorite celebrities or hobbies—learning grammar and writing becomes a more dynamic experience.

For teachers and students alike, NoRedInk represents a significant leap forward in writing education. It combines robust technology with a keen understanding of pedagogical needs, ensuring that students are not just learning but mastering essential skills. You can find more about NoRedInk and explore their offerings by visiting their [website](http://www.noredink.com) or checking out their [career opportunities](https://www.noredink.com/jobs).
